intro: Connarus venezuelanus, commonly known as the Venezuelan connarus, is a species of flowering plant native to South America, specifically Venezuela. It belongs to the family Myristicaceae, which includes aromatic trees and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a drupe, containing a single seed, and it is often found in humid, tropical environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
